Stephanie Plum has her sights set on catching a notorious mob boss. If she doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t take him down, he may take her out.
 
New Jersey bounty hunter Stephanie Plum knows better than to mess with family. But when powerful mobster Salvatore Ã¢â‚¬Å“Uncle SunnyÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ Sunucchi goes on the lam in Trenton, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s up to Stephanie to find him. Uncle Sunny is charged with murder for running over a guy (twice), and nobody wants to turn him inÃ¢â‚¬â€not his poker buddies, not his bimbo girlfriend, not his two right-hand men, Shorty and Moe. Even TrentonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s hottest cop, Joe Morelli, has skin in the game, becauseÃ¢â‚¬â€just StephanieÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s luckÃ¢â‚¬â€the godfather is his actual godfather. And while Morelli understands that the law is the law, his old-world grandmother, Bella, is doing everything she can to throw Stephanie off the trail. 
 
ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not just Uncle Sunny giving Stephanie the run-around. Security specialist Ranger needs her help to solve the bizarre death of a top clientÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s mother, a woman who happened to play bingo with StephanieÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Grandma Mazur. Before Stephanie knows it, sheÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s working side by side with Ranger and Grandma at the senior center, trying to catch a killer on the looseÃ¢â‚¬â€and the bingo balls are not rolling in their favor.
